result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis Anthony Prescott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. The first 2 months will be served STRAIGHT TIME, the remaining 6 months will be served with Huber privileges, or at the Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT: Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with ZERO days credit CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1. The first 2 months will be served STRAIGHT TIME, the remaining 6 months will be served with Huber privileges, or at the Day Reporting Center.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. The first 2 months will be served STRAIGHT TIME, the remaining 6 months will be served with Huber privileges, or at the Day Reporting Center.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with ZERO days credit CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1. The first 2 months will be served STRAIGHT TIME, the remaining 6 months will be served with Huber privileges, or at the Day Reporting Center.


Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Marquis Anthony Prescott in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant has made up missed office visit with Justice Point, bail review is canceled in Branch 22.  Court will address at next court date.
Bail/bond hearing at 02-18-2016 08:30 am
